reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Conserving the west African Manatee: Capacity building for long-term success

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to build capacity and develop a network of African conservationists who can implement grassroots conservation actions for the West African manatee (Trichechus senegalensis), collect and analyze samples that are critically needed to increase understanding of the species, and to disseminate results. The project will: 1) Develop capacity and resources of protected area managers and field personnel to take action against key threats to manatees in Central Africa. Activities include training at workshops, providing guidance, giving field sampling equipment, providing standardized datasheets and materials for data collection, maintaining an internet discussion group for African manatee conservationists, and working with collaborators to report and disseminate results. 2) Increase sampling for first regional population level assessment of West African manatee genetic diversity, feeding ecology and longevity. Activities include increasing surveys to determine manatee presence and habitat use, collecting biological samples, determining distinct populations, analyzing manatee diet, using ear bones of manatee carcasses to determine species longevity, and collecting other samples to determine baseline health paramaters for manatees..

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. engagement in Cameroon seeks to advance regional peace while encouraging development by strengthening healthcare systems. Foreign assistance contributes towards achieving these objectives by implementing programs that seek to strengthen the national response to the HIV/AIDS pandemic and increase the professionalism and effectiveness of Cameroon's military forces.
